comments:
[Accessibility Testing] Cannot open/save test editors/views when running JAWS and Window-Eyes before Eclipse is started.

Based on the TPTP V4.2.0 Accessibility Test Pass (see http://www-306.ibm.com/able/guidelines/index.html), the test editors/views (e.g. New -> Other... -> Test -> * -  that is, *.testsuite, *.location, *.artifact and *.deploy) could not be opened when running Window-Eyes before Eclipse is started.  The following exception is thrown:

java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find resource for bundle org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.ManifestLocalization$LocalizationResourceBundle, key W_NAME
	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getObject(ResourceBundle.java:342)

	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.tools.ui.common.internal.editor.TestSuiteForm.load(TestSuiteForm.java:204)

	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.editor.form.util.EditorForm.createFormClient(EditorForm.java:140)

If Eclipse is started first, then Window Eyes is opened, files of these types remain open and are accessible (have their content read), but new items of these types cannot be opened.  

Using JAWS appears to correct this problem but introduces another issue when saving the content in the various test editors:  

Can't find resource for bundle org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.ManifestLocalization$LocalizationResourceBundle, key W_DESCRIPTION

Created an attachment (id=45958)
WindowEyes Screen Capture Two.

Created an attachment (id=45960)
WindowEyes Screen Capture One.

It seems that the W_NAME and W_DESCRIPTION keys for the information section of the  overview tab of editors are missing.
I guess that there are usally found in plateform plugin but when windows eyes is running maybe the order of some plateform plugins may change, those keys are not found.

Defining new words for those keys

W_NAME = Name
W_DESCRIPTION = Description

works.

Due to PII blocked in 4.2.1 this defect is defered to 4.3i2
ACTION: Please update the target to the release AND iteration that this defect was returned/fixed.
